com.xhive.federationset.interfaces
Class XhiveFederationSetFactory

java.lang.Object
  com.xhive.federationset.interfaces.XhiveFederationSetFactory

public final class XhiveFederationSetFactory
extends java.lang.Object

Contains static methods to create and retrieve federation sets.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 7.0

Method Detail

createFederationSet

public static void createFederationSet(java.lang.String filename)
                                throws java.io.IOException
Create a new empty federation set. The new federation set will not contain any federations.

Parameters:
filename - The name of the federation set description file.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 7.0

deleteFederationSet

public static void deleteFederationSet(java.lang.String filename)
                                throws java.io.IOException
Delete a federation set description file. This does not delete any of the contained federations or nested federation sets.

The implementation simply deletes the specified file, without checking that it is in fact a federation set.

Parameters:
filename - Name of the federation set description file to delete.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 7.0

getFederationSet

public static XhiveFederationSetIf getFederationSet(java.lang.String federationSet,
                                                    XhivePageCacheIf pageCache)
                                             throws java.io.IOException
Get a federation set. The federationSet parameter can be either the name of a federation set description file or a URL of the form xhive://host:port, referring to a federation set server.

Parameters:
federationSet - The federation set to use or connect to.
pageCache - The page cache to initialize any XhiveDriverIf objects retrieved by this federation set. If the federation set will not be used to retrieve drivers, this parameter can be null.
Returns:
A federation set.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 7.0

getFederation

public static XhiveDriverIf getFederation(java.lang.String federation,
                                          XhivePageCacheIf pageCache)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
Get a driver for a specified federation. This is a convenience method that allows you to retrieve a federation using only a string. If the specified federation URL does not contain the '#' character, it is interpreted as a federation bootstrap path. Otherwise, the part before the '#' is interpreted as a federation set, while the part after the '#' is a '/' separated list of names. All but the last name are then looked up as nested federation sets, while the last name is looked up as a federation in the last federation set.

Parameters:
federation - The path to the federation.
pageCache - The page cache that will be used by the federation sets and the federation retrieved.
Returns:
A driver that is already initialized with the specified page cache.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
Since:
X-Hive/DB 7.0
